results.title: Secondary preventive effects of a calcium antagonist for ischemic heart attack: randomized parallel comparison with beta-blockers.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: A total of 120 @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Rupture_Post_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006342 @@@post-MI@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (71 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who were at least 1 month after the onset @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@AMI@@@ and 49 stable @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a history of MI) were randomly assigned to receive a BB (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 25-50mg/day, n=60) or a CCA (@CHEMICAL_benidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C061004 @@@benidipine@@@, 4-8 mg/day, n=60).

citations.NLM: Nakagomi A, Kodani E, Takano H, Uchida T, Sato N, Ibuki C, Kusama Y, Seino Y, Munakata K, Mizuno K, Takano T. Secondary preventive effects of a calcium antagonist for ischemic heart attack: randomized parallel comparison with beta-blockers. Circ J. 2011;75(7):1696-705. PMID: 21576828
